intro: Gnaphalium decipiens, commonly known as the false everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are typically gray-green, covered in fine hairs, and arranged in a rosette pattern. Gnaphalium decipiens is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
